name: Boutique Hoi An Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nicely built hotel, lovely big room with a balcony, great pool, nice spa and decent spot of beach. It could be great but the lack of care and service sorely lets it down. With one or two exceptions, the staff were miserable and did nothing to make you feel like you were paying reasonable cash (by Vietnam standards) to stay at a good hotel. Whilst the place is quite new, it already feels tired in parts because standards have not been kept up e.g. soap dispenser broken and unusable in the pool bathrooms, spa bathrooms lacking any toiletries other then one set of shampoo and shower gel to be shared between all showers, towels throughout stained and worn. Breakfast was just ok. We often had to ask to be served tea and no effort was made to clean tables between sittings. We used the bikes one day only to discover within 5 mins we had a flat. When we returned to the hotel and told the bike attendant all he had to say when we pointed to the flat tyre was "yes I know". One day the pool ran out of towels. Room cleaning was patchy - often not until late in the day, sometimes they replaced towels, sometimes they took old ones away but didn't leave clean ones. None of these things would be a big deal in isolation but one thing after another becomes a bit eye rolling when you're supposed to be in a good hotel. Ok as a base only to explore Hoi An but don't rely on this place for anything more. Also a bit big and busy to be described as 'boutique'. I agree with other reviews that it feels soulless. Two sets of friends stayed here independently when it first opened and highly recommended it. Sadly with the passing of time it seems standards and service have slipped. Management, please sort things out!
reviews.title: Has potential, but disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the balcony with view over the ocean and out door furniture. The room (402) top floor was spacious and clean. The bathroom had some issues. The shower door does not close properly and we had our daily floods. There was no mold in the bathroom, but that is due to the fan that can not be controlled which means it is running day and night.
reviews.title: Stayed for five nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was wonderful, great fruits, salads, sitting outside. Just the "tourist coffee" needs improvement. Order espresso instead.
reviews.title: 5 star peace!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner there once and it was not the greatest, far to expensive for the food offered.
reviews.title: Me in a Villa, WOW!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The spa was very enjoy able. I got a foot massage on the house and had bought a facial. They use natural products (cucumbers, water melon) which felt very, very good on my face. I tried for another appointment, but could not get one. Book early, esp. if a bus load of people arrived.
reviews.title: Boutique Hoi An Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything we needed was here. The setting is lovely, right on the beach and the gardens that surround the rooms are lovely. Our room was beautiful with a great balcony overlooking the pool. There was wireless internet everywhere on the resort which was great, especially for working out how much a million or so Dong was! Breakfast was good in the restaurant and so was dinner. The pool side cafe served superb Vietnamese salads at lunchtime. The hotel runs a free shuttle bus in the evenings into Hoi An but make a note of where it drops you, we got lost! We had very good Vietnamese massages at a very reasonable price at the Spa in the hotel. This really is a lovely place to stay and all the staff were very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Very well equipped hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is of a medium size situated right on the beach but has a good simming pool as well .The hotel is very well maintained clean and comfortable with a nice restaurant that offers very good food if you don"t fancy going to one of the great local eating houses in town.The town is a bit to far to walk unless you are used to walking in the heat but the hotel provides a shuttle bus and there is nearly always a taxi out side. All staff are friendly nice and happy to help especially young Mr Tham .Would recommend to friends and family
reviews.title: Just great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is lovely. The buildings are charming, the grounds manicured, the pool terrific and the private beach is perfect. Our only complaints were the smallish rooms with a tiny closet and no drawers or storage at all. It made it difficut to enjoy the room with clothes piled on chairs and open suitcases.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: This is a great hotel and very good value package. We would definitely recommend without hesitation.
reviews.title: Great location great hotel and friendly helpful staff-what more can you want?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel management are aware of the issue with the shower design and the slight water overflow.
reviews.title: simple the best in HoiAn !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: Located about a mile outside of town, it's an ideal location along the river. The nicest pool I've seen in a long time, quaint French decor rooms, excellent staff, good food for a very reasonable price - think full dinner with a glass of wine for $12. Highly recommend it.
reviews.title: A great resort for a reasonable price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live since 3 years in Vietnam and also tried a lot of different hotels here.
reviews.title: Best price service deal in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In my opinion this is one of the best deals we made in Hoi An.
reviews.title: Touch of Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: The hotel is not so big and busy. The staff is friendly.
reviews.title: Good upmarket choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean. The food is good. And the pool area and beach access is nice.
reviews.title: Peacful and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely place. The hotel building is all in white and sparkles in the sunshine. It has an air of openness and light. A path from the restaurant leads across the lawns and through the palm trees to the pool and then beyond to the beach. We enjoyed every moment of our stay and were very well looked after. Our room was lovely and well specified, with a balcony looking down towards the pool. The breakfasts were excellent and the service at all times was first class. Although the hotel is 5km from the old town of Hoi An, there is a regular free shuttle bus, and the taxi we used on one occasion charged only $10.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very well-situated hotel on a beach. The only problem for us was that we had terrible weather while we were there and weren't able to use the pool or the beach, which was very frustrating as we were looking forward to both and had the only day off of our tour while we were there. The hotel was very good though and the food for breakfast was excellent. We used the free shuttle bus a lot as going in to Hoi An was the only option in the rain. We thoroughly explored Hoi An and managed to do a lot of souvenir shopping there as well as enjoying cocktails and very good meals at the bars and restaurants there.We filled in the hotel questionnaire with a couple of very minor quibbles and were surprised to hear from the management on our return saying that they had been fixed - very impressive!
reviews.title: A quiet comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: We have just returned from a three week trip across Malaysia and Vietnam, what a great place to end a fabulous holiday, the setting and design of the hotel are spot on, breakfasts great and the free shuttle into Hoi an is an added bonus, a must go back hotel, loved it.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel right on the beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights, 5 days with my fiancé in March 2013. Its a beautiful clean hotel with a warm, friendly service. Definitely could be considered a 5 star over a 4 star. On arrival they kindly offered to upgrade our room for free. We had a very wonderfuly designed deluxe villa on a well maintained, palm lined lawn that was literally 60 steps away from the beach! I could see and hear the ocean from my room. The spa facilities were of a great standard, and very cheap. One hour full body Swedish style massage was about £20. You look to pay at least double or more for that in London. Breakfast was vast, we had dinner one evening which was room service and it was delicious. Free shuttle to town which was only a 10 min drive away. The town has a wonderful charm. Had a truly lovely stay. Definitely book Boutique Hoi An. : )
reviews.title: Stunning hotel on a palm beach front, with fantastic service, spa and food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A gorgeous resort right on the beach, reasonably well maintained (occasional loose hinges, broken blind cord, but nothing major). Staff great, and we can't complain about being upgraded because of a shortage of rooms (overbooking?) Our only real gripe was that on checking out we were charged £17 for the "complimentary" water bags, and for the bathroom slippers (we assumed they were part of the package). We were also a bit miffed that a message sent to the hotel about the late arrival of our guide didn't get to us, so perhaps a problem of internal communication. But a othwise great place to stay just outside Hoi An.
reviews.title: Nice, but...

aka: Boutique Hoi An Hotel Hoi An
description: The resort is set on the renowned ‘Cua Dai Beach’ Hoi An. With its central location, the resort is only 35 minutes from Da Nang airport and 5 minutes to explore the old heritage town of Hoi An. The ancient town of Hoi An, 30 km south of Da Nang, lies on the banks of the Thu Bon River. Occupied by early western traders, Hoi An was one of the major trading centers of Southeast Asia in the 16th century.Hoi An has a distinct Vietnamese atmosphere with low, tile-roofed houses and narrow streets; the original structure of some of these streets still remains almost intact. All the houses were made of wood, decorated with lacquered boards and panels engraved with old ancient characters. Pillars were also carved with ornamental designs. Hoi An have earned the town status as a heritage site by the UNESCO and has become a very popular tourist destination in Vietnam.All rooms are facing the sea with private balconies and some have direct access to the beach from private terraces. Room facilities featured single and double vanity, bathtub or shower, air-conditioning, television, IDD telephone, mini bar, safety box, hairdryer, wireless internet, coffee and tea making facilities. A large swimming pool is in the center of the resort surrounded by a tropical garden. A spa, located next to the pool, is a haven for pure relaxation and rejuvenation. Our spa facilities include three treatment rooms, five massage pavilions and two steam rooms. Pedicure and manicure services are also available at our resort’s spa.
